resources.string: Enter an Id for this sensor
The expected sensor was not found.
This feature is not supported by this device
Can\'t use camera. Make sure flashlight is off and close any apps that may be using the camera
A back facing camera is required for colorimetric analysis
If the problem continues, restart this device
A camera flash was not found on this device
Do you want to calibrate now?
Place device face down on a flat surface
Do not move the phone during the test
Colour does not match any calibrated colours.
Check that the chamber has been placed correctly.
Incorrect calibration can affect the proper functioning of the sensor
Get ready the fluid with EC of %.0f μS/cm
Dip EC Sensor in the fluid and press Go
Calibration is past its reagent expiry date
Please order a fresh batch of reagent and recalibrate
Due to high level of contamination, it is recommended to test with dilution
Place strip in black area of the colour card & hold camera above it to analyse.
Don\'t take sample yet. Hold camera above colour card and adjust position until check succeeds.
You can set the phone aside until the countdown progress reaches green.
Prepare 6 solutions with these EC values
The camera does not meet the minimum requirements.\n\nFor best results, at least 8 megapixel camera required.
Place the colour card in an area with good light and no shadows and try again.
Hold the phone level with colour card
This version of the app has expired.
Please uninstall and then install the latest version from Play Store.
Press [*down*] to scroll to Bluetooth and press [*enter*]
Press [*enter*] and [*esc*] to return to main menu.
Perform %1$s test on MD610 and press [*f3*] when ready.
Select the correct test and try again.
Received data does not match the expected test type.
Press [*shift*] + %1$s to select %2$s test and then press [*enter*]
Press [*shift*] + %1$s to select %2$s test. Select \'diff\' and then press [*enter*]
Press [*shift*] + %1$s to select %2$s test. Select \'free\' and then press [*enter*]
Press [*shift*] + %1$s to select %2$s test. Select \'Cr(VI)\' and then press [*enter*]
Press [*shift*] + %1$s to select %2$s test. Select \'Cr(III+VI)\' and then press [*enter*]
Fill vial (10 mm Ø) with 5 ml of your sample, wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*zero*]
Fill a clean vial (16 mm Ø) with 10 ml of water sample.
Fill a second clean vial (16 mm Ø) with 10 ml of the water sample.
Fill vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of your sample, wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*zero*]
Fill vial (24 mm Ø) with 1 ml of your sample and 9 ml of deionised water, wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*zero*]
Fill one clean vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of deionised water (this is the blank).
Fill another clean vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of the water sample (this is the sample)
Add water sample to the 10 ml mark in the vial
Add exactly %samplequantity ml of the water sample to the prepared vial. Caution: Vial is filled up to the top!
Remove the vial from the sample chamber.
Remove the vial from the sample chamber and empty it, leaving a few drops remaining in the vial.
Remove the vial from the sample chamber and empty the vial
Remove the vial from the sample chamber, empty the vial, rinse vial and cap several times and then fill the vial with %samplequantity ml of the water sample.
Add one %reagent1 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample and crush the tablet using a clean stirring rod
Add one %reagent2 tablet straight from the foil to the water sample and crush the tablet using a clean stirring rod
Add the contents of one %reagent1 powder pack straight from the foil to the vial.
Add the contents of one %reagent2 powder pack straight from the foil to the vial.
Add the contents of one %reagent1 powder pack straight from the foil to each vial.
Add the contents of one %reagent2 powder pack straight from the foil to each vial.
Add the contents of two (!) %reagent1 powder packs straight from the foil into the water sample.
Fill the vial with drops of the same size by holding the bottle vertically and squeeze slowly: %reagent1
Fill the vial with drops of the same size by holding the bottle vertically and squeeze slowly: %reagent2
Add exactly %reagent1 reagent solution to the water sample. (Caution: Vial is filled up to the top!)
Fill the Nitrate test tube with 20 ml of the water sample.
Add one level spoon of Nitrate Test powder.
Add one level spoon of reagent KP119 (Ascorbic Acid) to the same water sample
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl several times to mix the contents
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl gently several times.
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl several times to mix the contents. Wait until purple coloration goes before continuing.
Close the vial tightly with the cap and invert several times to mix the contents.
Close the vial tightly with the cap and invert several times to dissolve the powder
Close the vial tightly with the cap and invert gently several times to mix the contents
Close the vials with the cap tightly. Invert the vial gently several times to mix the contents. (CAUTION: The vial will become hot during mixing!)
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl several times until the tablet is dissolved.
Close the vials with the caps and shake to mix the contents.
Close the vial(s) tightly with the cap(s) and shake thoroughly until the reagent is dissolved completely.
Close the vial tightly with the cap and swirl gently (do not shake heavily!) several times until the tablet is dissolved
Close the tube tightly with the cap and swirl vigorously for one minute.
Wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*test*]
Wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*test*]. Wait for a reaction time of %reactiontime1 minutes.
Wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*test*]. Wait for a reaction time of %reactiontime2 minutes.
Wipe the outside of the prepared vial, hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*zero*]
Wipe the outside of the vial (blank), hold vial at the lid and place vial (blank) in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*zero*]
Wipe the outside of the vial (blank), hold vial at the lid and place vial (blank) in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*zero*]. Wait for a reaction period of %reactiontime1 minutes.
Wipe the outside of the vial (the sample), hold vial at the lid and place vial (the sample) in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*test*]
Press [*enter*] and wait for a reaction period of %reactiontime1 minutes
Press [*enter*] and wait for a reaction period of %reactiontime2 minutes
Insert the adapter for 13 mm Ø round vials.
Insert the adapter for 16 mm Ø vials
Open one white capped reaction vial and add 1 ml of the water sample. Close the cap tightly.
Open one white capped reaction vial and add 2 ml deionised water (this is the blank)
Open another white capped reaction vial and add 2 ml of the water sample (this is the sample).
Open one white capped reaction vial and add 0.1 ml deionised water (this is the blank)
Open another white capped reaction vial and add 0.1 ml of the water sample (this is the sample).
Open one white capped reaction vial and add 0.2 ml deionised water (this is the blank)
Open another white capped reaction vial and add 0.2 ml of the water sample (this is the sample).
Heat the vial for 120 minutes in a preheated thermoreactor at a temperature of 100°C.
Heat the vials for 120 minutes in the preheated reactor at a temperature of 150°C. (CAUTION: The vials are hot!)
Remove the vial from the thermoreactor. (CAUTION: The vials are hot!). Invert the vial and allow to cool to room temperature. Do not place the hot vials in the sample chamber.

(CAUTION: The vials are hot!) Remove the tubes from the heating block and allow them to cool to 60°C. or less. Mix the contents by carefully inverting each tube several times while still warm. Then allow the tubes to cool to ambient temperature before measuring. Do not place the hot vials in the sample chamber.

1. Stand the tube upright and after the reducing agent has settled to the bottom, gently invert it three to four times so as to complete the flocculation of the reducing agent. Then let the tube stand for a further 2 minutes. 2. Open the tube and wipe around the top of the tube with a clean tissue to remove any residuals of the reducing agent. 3. Carefully decant 10 ml of the treated solution into the vial (24 mm Ø) used for zeroing, ensuring that no reducing agent is carried over.
Place the blank in the sample chamber. The blank is part of the test kit. Press [*zero*]

Remove the blank from the sample chamber. Water should flow through the special sample container for several minutes to remove any air bubbles sticking at the surface. The water must flow from the bottom to the top.

When the sample container is bubble-free press one Vacu-vial® into the lower edge of the sample container. The Vacu-vial® breaks at the neck and the vial fills automatically. A small volume of inert gas remains in the Vacu-vial

1. Remove the Vacu-vial® point downwards from the sample container immediately (within 5 seconds). 2. The Vacu-vial® is closed with one finger (covered with a glove) to prevent entry of air. Invert the vial several times. Dry the outside of the vial.
Place the Vacu-vial® in the sample chamber and press [*test*]
Fill a clean 20 ml syringe with approx. 14 ml water sample.
Connect the syringe to the filtration assembly (using a GF/C filter) and discharge the syringe to waste, down to the 10 ml mark.
Fill vial (24 mm Ø) with 10 ml of your sample from the syringe, wipe the outside of the vial, hold vial at the lid and place vial in the chamber. Align arrow marks and press [*zero*]
Blend approx. 500 ml of the water sample (e.g. in a blender) at high speed for 2 minutes.
Stir the blended water sample. Immediately rinse the vial with the water sample and fill with 10 ml water sample.
Stir the water sample. Immediately rinse the vial with the water sample and fill with 10 ml water sample.
Collect 100 ml water sample with bottle or Thio Bag.
Avoid touching the inside of the bottle, lid or Thio Bag with bare hands.
Open growth medium sachet and add test bud straight to the sample from the sachet
Dissolve medium in sample for 10–12 minutes maximum by periodically swirling the bottle or squeezing the test bud in the Thio Bag to promote release of the medium from its plastic carrier
The medium dissolves from its plastic carrier.
When medium is completely dissolved, the plastic carrier turns white or nearly white.
Label the compartment bag before filling
Tear of perforated seam at top of the bag.
Rub sides at the top of each compartment to open the bag, use the white tabs at top of the bag to keep the bag open while pouring.
Slowly pour sample into bag while gently tilting and squeezing bag to distribute sample amongst five compartments.
Fill evenly across bag to the black fill line .
Leave test bud carrier in bottle or Thio Bag while pouring.
Attach seal clip across the bag above the fill line and below the compartment top openings.
Snap rod-shaped part of the clip from other side of bag into U-shape to lock in place across the bag.
After attaching clip, bag can be kept vertical or horizontal.
Close the top of the bag with the yellow Whirl-Pak seal and then roll down the bag toward the seal clip and fold the yellow ends.
Let the sample incubate, depending on the ambient temperature:

Incubate in a portable incubator, preferably at 35–37 °C for 48 hours or put in or near another heat source. In addition to portable incubators, samples can be maintained at 25°C to 44.5°C using: thermal coolers/bags; proximity to heat sources for humans and food; poultry or reptile incubator, or near refrigerator coils or room heating vents
Take photo of the incubated sample.
Change the colours in the interface below to match the colours of the interface to sample.
Click the compartments to change colour.
